title: Extracting Training Data from Diffusion Models

last_post.content:
This time Google does the right thing - while shareholders grill them over "competition" with ChatGPT (not really...), they research and publish how useful and privacy preserving large models are.

It turns out, as suspected, they are not very useful for actual professional writers who understand "something" about writing: https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.05030

...and leak the dataset/private data, 2x worse with diffusion than GANs: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13188

No wonder Google is hesitant to use them. :)

title: New AI classifier for indicating AI-written text

last_post.content:
So OpenAI just released a detector of AI-generated text, I assume because of concerns in education / homework.

https://openai.com/blog/new-ai-classifier-for-indicating-ai-written-text/

Maybe this is good?

No, it's very bad.

They claim 26% true positives, 9% false positives. Assume 10% of submitted homework is chatgpt generated, you get the classic counterintuitive outcome of poor predictive power: if a homework is flagged, there's a 3:1 chance it's *human* generated.

This is going to cause a lot of harm. It should be immediately recalled.

"If we switched to renewable energy, the number of ships crossing the ocean would fall almost in half. Because they're just carrying #coal and #oil and gas" -Bill McKibben on Bird.

Port of Long Beach exports a good deal of #petroleum coke & coal that are deemed too dirty to burn in the US. #Shipping fuel is itself filthy (dirtier than diesel).

Map is a screenshot of global marine traffic (red vessels are #tankers), via http://marinetraffic.com

Shift Happens, a book about keyboards, launches on Kickstarter 7 Feb at 9 am PST: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mwichary/shift-happens – click at KS to get notified.

At 11 am PST that day, join a livestream of author & designer of Shift Happens, Marcin Wichary @mwichary He’ll be in conversation with designer & writer Robin Rendle about the stories in the book, the keyboards Marcin met along the way, and what the whole project means to him. https://youtube.com/live/ktIuUa0uf7E?feature=share Click to get a YouTube notification about the live event.

Brilliant guide for Mastodon lists written by @judell.

Basically, he fed Mastodon's API into Steampipe, and it resulted in a kickass export!

It's pretty neat what you can do with Mastodon's API -- and I see tremendous opportunities.

Not for beginners, but if you're technically inclined, you'll love this sweet how-to.

https://www.infoworld.com/article/3686609/working-with-mastodon-lists.html

title: Visualizing Distributions with Raincloud Plots (and How to Create Them with ggplot2) - Cédric Scherer

last_post.content: nice examples of how only boxplots are not enough https://www.cedricscherer.com/2021/06/06/visualizing-distributions-with-raincloud-plots-and-how-to-create-them-with-ggplot2/ #rstats #bioinformatics #visualization

Catastrophic (and to be frank - hugely depressing)

This new research in @PNASNews suggests earth will cross the 1.5 degrees C temperature increase threshold in the next decade (within just 10 to 15 years) and is likely to exceed 2 degrees C by around 2060.

This should be THE lead story on the news today (and onwards) and the lead action point for our governments. It should trigger a massive call for real global action to combat the #climateemergency - sadly though I fear this news will barely register.

We have to stop believing the siren calls of future technology solutions and #carbonoffsets - the immediate need is a rapid end to the use of #fossilfuels and a massive rollout of #renewableenergy

https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2207183120

#ClimateChange #ClimateCrisis

🇫🇷 On the difficulties of algorithmic regulation:

The French transport authority wanted to do an algorithmic audit, but realized that the Terms of Services of the platforms forbade data scraping.

French parliament had to change the law (on Jan 23d) to fix the issue.

https://www.nosdeputes.fr/16/amendement/619/CD10

title: University strikes ON after universities refuse to make further commitments on pensions, pay and working conditions

last_post.content:
UCU members at 150 UK universities are walking out on Wednesday 1 February.

Two disputes over pensions, pay and working conditions will affect 2.5 million students.

17 further days of strike action are planned.

https://www.ucu.org.uk/article/12770/University-strikes-ON-after-universities-refuse-to-make-further-commitments-on-pensions-pay-and-working-conditions

#ucuRISING

Hey #academia bubble aus dem #Ruhrgebiet, speziell #Bochum: Ich bin die nächsten zwei Wochen regelmäßig vormittags zwischen 8 und ca. 15 Uhr in Bochum und frage mich jetzt, ob es da einen netten Ort gibt, an dem ich (mit Hundebegleitung durch https://mastodon.world/@rattenhundrey) arbeiten kann.

Die Alternative ist morgens nach Bochum fahren, zurück nach Essen, nachmittags zurück nach Bochum und dann wieder nach Essen, was mir ziemlich unsinnig erscheint.

Vielleicht weiß @felwert ja was?

last_post.content:
Once, dwarves frequently haunted a baking hut (a separate small building with a communal oven) in Bondorf.

But they vanished forever when someone spied on them and witnessed that they baked while naked.

title: Unable to burn digital books, Orange Unified School District bans the whole virtual library | Boing Boing

last_post.content:
One thing I'll say for the wave of Republican book-banning that's going on right now -- it's certainly making books seem powerful and *significant*

Book-banning is of course a terrible way to have the public re-realize the catalytic effect a good book can have on its readers

Nonetheless, here we are: https://boingboing.net/2023/01/31/unable-to-burn-digital-books-orange-unified-school-district-bans-the-whole-virtual-library.html
